alert.note: Alert for Brown; Cherry; Keya Paha; Thomas (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 23 at 11:51PM CDT until June 24 at 12:30AM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: The National Weather Service in North Platte has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Eastern Cherry County in north central Nebraska... Northwestern Brown County in north central Nebraska... North central Thomas County in north central Nebraska... Southwestern Keya Paha County in north central Nebraska... * Until 1230 AM CDT. * At 1150 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 11 miles west of Valentine to 11 miles north of Mullen, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. * Locations impacted include... Valentine, Brownlee, Valentine National Wildlife Refuge, Merritt Reservoir, Norden, Wood Lake, Highway 97 crossing the North Loup River, North River Trail, Highway 83 crossing the North Loup River, Marsh Flat, Giant Hill, Sevenmile Hill. This includes the following highways... Highway 20 between mile markers 188 and 228. Highway 2 between mile markers 213 and 216. Highway 97 between mile markers 75 and 141. Highway 83 between mile markers 150 and 216. Highway 12 between mile markers 1 and 4, and between mile markers 27 and 34. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 100 AM CDT for north central Nebraska. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 100 AM CDT for north central Nebraska.
